text: Éric Diard (born 21 July 1965, in Marseille) is a member of the National Assembly of France. He represented the Bouches-du-Rhône's 12th constituency, from between 2002 and 2012 and again from 2017 onwards as a member of the Republicans. He was the mayor of Sausset-les-Pins since 2001. He led a parliamentary investigation into radicalization in French security services. ==References== Category:1965 births Category:Living people Category:People from Marseille Category:Union for a Popular Movement politicians Category:The Republicans (France) politicians Category:The Popular Right Category:Deputies of the 15th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Mayors of places in Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur Category:Deputies of the 12th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Deputies of the 13th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic
title: Éric Diard
